</subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Eurostat New Cronos</i> database contains high quality macroeconomic and social statistics time series data from 1950 onwards for the 25 European Union (EU) Member states and in many cases for the central European countries, Japan, the United States and the main economic partners of the EU. The data are monthly, quarterly, bi-annual or annual data, depending on the variable and country selected and are organised into nine statistical themes:<ul><li>general statistics</li><li>economy and finance</li><li>population and social conditions</li><li>industry, trade and services</li><li>agriculture and fisheries</li><li>external trade</li><li>transport</li><li>environment and energy</li><li>science and technology</li></ul>The <i>Eurostat New Cronos</i> database was first provided by the UK Data Service in September 2004. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its <i>New Cronos</i> holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/new-cronos.aspx" title="Eurostat New Cronos dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/eurostat/nc/2011-03-10" title="Eurostat New Cronos latest database updates">latest database updates<a/>.<br> <br> <b>Citation:</b> The bibliographic citation for the databases is: Eurostat (<i>{YYYY}</i>): New Cronos (<i>{date/edition of dataset}</i>). Mimas, University of Manchester. DOI: <i>{edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/eurostat/nc/2011-03-10">http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/eurostat/nc/2011-03-10<a/>}</i>. <br> <br> Access to the Eurostat New Cronos is currently via Eurostat's own data dissemination interface.  <br> <br> Note: The UK Data Service team at Mimas aim to ingest this data into the UKDS.Stat interface in the future, so it will be searchable alongside the rest of the international macrodata portfolio.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The database includes:<ul><li>general statistics - major indicators for the member states of the European Union, non-member countries, applicant countries and regions</li><li>economy and finance - data on national accounts, prices and purchasing power parities, such as statistics on currency and the finance sector</li><li>population and social conditions - statistics on population, health, employment, consumption and living conditions</li><li>industry, trade and services - indicators and statistics on industrial activity, production, wholesale and retail trade, banks and services in Europe</li><li>agriculture and fisheries - accounts, indices, prices and statistics</li><li>external trade - statistics on intra- and extra-European Union trade</li><li>transport - data on air, rail, road and inland waterway transport in the European Union</li><li>environment and energy - statistics and indicators on the impact of population on the environment (production of waste, emissions and pollutants, climate, biodiversity, etc.), information on impact on the economy (environmental expenditure)</li><li>science and technology - information on research and development, innovation and employment in the advanced-technology sectors (available for the member states of the European Union and non-member countries)</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate>Data coverage begins in 1950 and are updated annually. The data include projections to 2060.</collDate>         <nation>Austria</nation>         <nation>Belgium</nation>         <nation>Cyprus</nation>         <nation>Czech Republic</nation>         <nation>Denmark</nation>         <nation>Estonia</nation>         <nation>European Union Countries</nation>         <nation>Finland</nation>         <nation>France</nation>         <nation>German Democratic Republic</nation>         <nation>German Federal Republic</nation>         <nation>Germany (October 1990-)</nation>         <nation>Greece</nation>         <nation>Hungary</nation>         <nation>Ireland</nation>         <nation>Italy</nation>         <nation>Japan</nation>         <nation>Latvia</nation>         <nation>Lithuania</nation>         <nation>Luxembourg</nation>         <nation>Malta</nation>         <nation>Netherlands</nation>         <nation>Poland</nation>         <nation>Portugal</nation>         <nation>Slovakia</nation>         <nation>Slovenia</nation>         <nation>Spain</nation>         <nation>Sweden</nation>         <nation>Turkey</nation>         <nation>United Kingdom</nation>         <nation>United States</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Administrative units (geographical/political)</anlyUnit>         <universe>Cross-national; National</universe>         <universe>The 25 countries of the European Union, and selected others for some series.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Aggregate (macro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Time Series</timeMeth>         <timeMeth>bi-annual, annual, quarterly and monthly (dependant on variable and country chosen). The database is updated every six months.</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See the <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/new-cronos.aspx> dataset user guide</a> for details on sampling.</sampProc>         <collMode>See the <a href=http://ukdataservice.ac.uk//use-data/guides/dataset/new-cronos.aspx> dataset user guide</a> for details of the methodology used.</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. Additional special conditions of use also apply. See <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/conditions/specialconditions.aspx'>terms and conditions</a> for further information.<br/><br/> Available to those registered at UK institutions of higher or further education only.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>         <conditions>Access to the Eurostat New Cronos is currently via Eurostat's own data dissemination interface.  <br> <br> Note: The UK Data Service team at Mimas aim to ingest this data into the UKDS.Stat interface in the future, so it will be searchable alongside the rest of the international macrodata portfolio. </conditions>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
